Class FaceCNet

  • java.lang.Object
    • testNets.FaceCNet

  • public class FaceCNet
extends java.lang.Object
    Looks at people's faces and chooses own focus.
    Author:
    lana

      • createCNet

        private void createCNet()
        set the sizes of arrays

      • initCNet

        private void initCNet()
        fills list with neurons

      • makeNeurons

        private void makeNeurons(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,CNeuron> sensory,
                         java.util.ArrayList<CMotorNeuron> motor)
        make neurons taking input from this sensors, activation depends on this motor/proprio, controls these actions. One hidden neuron per eye sensor, per motor neuron, with weights towards all actions and all sensors in same layer

      • buildInputs

        public void buildInputs()
        resets all neurons activations, then builds the sensory inputs, and activate all outside weights and action_weights accordingly.

      • buildEyeInput

        private void buildEyeInput()
        builds the sensory input from the focused image, set graphics, activates neurons in eye, activate corresponding weights

      • buildCoarse

        private int[] buildCoarse(int fph,
                          int fpw)
        builds "image" of sensory input
        Parameters:
        fph - -1..1 (relative motion on y height)
        fpw - -1..1 (relative motion on x width)
        Returns:
        activation values on sensors [gray scale id]*total resolusion
